Make your accounts more secure

At IT Solver, we take account security very seriously. To protect your account, we strongly recommend following the steps below.


If you find suspicious activity on your account, contact IT Solver to report or ask about a security issue.


To help make your internet accounts more secure, follow these steps.


Choose strong passwords and don't reuse them for other accounts

A strong password helps to:

  • Keep your personal information safe
  • Protect your emails, files, and other content
  • Prevent someone from breaking into your account


Get a password manager such as Lastpass or 1Password to make this task much easier.


Enroll in 2-step verification

When you enable 2-Step Verification (also known as two-factor authentication), you add an extra layer of security to your account. You sign in with something you know (your password) and something you have (a code sent to your phone).


For each website login:

  1. Sign in and go to the account settings
  2. Enable the option "2-step verification", aka. "two factor" or "multi-factor authentication"



Learn more about how to make your accounts more secure.

# Make your accounts more secure
At IT Solver, we take account security very seriously. To protect your account, we strongly recommend following the steps below.

If you find suspicious activity on your account, contact IT Solver to report or ask about a security issue.

To help make your internet accounts more secure, follow these steps.

## Choose strong passwords and don't reuse them for other accounts
A strong password helps to:

- Keep your personal information safe
- Protect your emails, files, and other content
- Prevent someone from breaking into your account

Get a password manager such as Lastpass or 1Password to make this task much easier.

## Enroll in 2-step verification
When you enable 2-Step Verification (also known as two-factor authentication), you add an extra layer of security to your account. You sign in with something you know (your password) and something you have (a code sent to your phone).

For each website login:

1. Sign in and go to the account settings
2. Enable the option "2-step verification", aka. "two factor" or "multi-factor authentication"

Learn more about how to make your accounts more secure.
